intro: Dissochaeta viminalis, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, poorly drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
